channel.title: Best AMD Budget Processor
channel.description: What is the best AMD budget processor I can get. I am trying to make a new gaming rig on the lowest budget possible. Any ideas? I would like references from newegg. I will pick the other things out myself.

item.title: Best AMD Budget Processor
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

horrible idea seeing as this isn't supported and some cores are disabled because they are faulty.

He wanted a dual i assume because it’s cheap, what i and Elijah pointed out was a cheap very powerful Dual core, with the ability to unlock the 3rd/4th core. I’ve seen reviews about about 60%+ manage to unlock both cores and have them stable non oc’ed.

Read full topic

item.title: Best AMD Budget Processor
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:15, topic:289715”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=382968.msg2875868#msg2875868 date=1248038134]

Get a 4850.

Also is that Wurm game you where talking about any good. Could you post a screenshot with max settings of yours?

What genre of games do you like? Perhaps members could recommend some.

I do like runescape like games but runescape bores me now. I like having to build up skills and being able to go whereever I want to go like role playing games but I enjoy high detail graphics. Usually I don’t like online games that much though.

I also like fps games.

So you like MMOs and FPSs.

FPS: BF2,CS:S,TF2,HL2DM,etc
MMOs: don’t know.
[/quote]
did you read his post?

Usually I don’t like online games that much though

that rules out MMO’s, RPGs like TES are different and would probably cater to his needs[/quote]
He mentioned RuneScape; and, yes I did read it.

Read full topic

item.title: Best AMD Budget Processor
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

In my opinion this is the best AMD processor to get period. For $99.00 and Free Shipping, it’s a Quad-Core, that’s been capped at two cores. It’s the equivalent of a pricier processor of the same family at 2/3 the price. And it’s Black edition, which means easy OC. You can up it to the Quad very easily I might add.

If you’re going to get an AMD processor, it better be this one.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103680

Read full topic

Also is that Wurm game you where talking about any good. Could you post a screenshot with max settings of yours?

What genre of games do you like? Perhaps members could recommend some.

I do like runescape like games but runescape bores me now. I like having to build up skills and being able to go whereever I want to go like role playing games but I enjoy high detail graphics. Usually I don’t like online games that much though.

I also like fps games.
[/quote]
So you like MMOs and FPSs.

FPS: BF2,CS:S,TF2,HL2DM,etc
MMOs: don’t know.[/quote]

Usually I don't like online games that much though
that rules out MMO's, RPGs like TES are different and would probably cater to his needs

item.title: Best AMD Budget Processor
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:13, topic:289715”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=382968.msg2875682#msg2875682 date=1248029768]

That one looks good. I was wondering what you thought of this one though?

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103300

Very low L2 cache and the fact it will run hot as fuck makes it a bad pick.
[/quote]
L2 cache per core is the same

get the AMD Athlon X2 550 callisto. cheap, and on a lot of motherboards you can unlock the extra 2 cores, most of the time.

horrible idea seeing as this isn’t supported and some cores are disabled because they are faulty.[/quote]
Didn’t notice that. Apparently processors with L3 cache have lower L2 cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Best AMD Budget Processor
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:4, topic:289715”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=382968.msg2875677#msg2875677 date=1248029640]
That one looks good. I was wondering what you thought of this one though?

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103300

[/quote]
Very low L2 cache and the fact it will run hot as fuck makes it a bad pick.[/quote]
L2 cache per core is the same

xEnt:

get the AMD Athlon X2 550 callisto. cheap, and on a lot of motherboards you can unlock the extra 2 cores, most of the time.

horrible idea seeing as this isn’t supported and some cores are disabled because they are faulty.

Read full topic

get the AMD Athlon X2 550 callisto. cheap, and on a lot of motherboards you can unlock the extra 2 cores, most of the time.
